alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Imperial Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 20 at 1:23PM PDT until March 21 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 11 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 to 45 mph. For the second Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Western Imperial County and Imperial Valley. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from noon to 11 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
